result.execSummary:
The defendant Monroe J Walton III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 

Consecutive to: Present Sentence
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with co-actor or with any businesses listed int the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Monroe J Walton in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Wolff makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Alonzo M. makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT           *CONSECUTIVE TO PRESENT SENTENCE*
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS        **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actor or with any businesses listed in the criminal complaint 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH**
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Monroe J Walton did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not brought here from Stanley Correctional, even though Order to Produce was done.   Defendant may be under an alias.     Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Stanley Correctional.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Monroe J Walton appears by videoconference from Stanley Correctional, in custody.   Attorney Peter M Wolff appears on behalf of Defendant.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.   Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Stanely Correctional.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys. Atty Wolff will substitutite Atty Williamson. Signed by Judge Carter on 03/28/16.
